oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Work camps
Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-1939
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Civilian Conservation Corps Camp 19, home of Civilian Conservation Corps Company 491.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Looking Back At Tennessee Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Civilian Conservation Corps Company 491 was formed on August 10, 1935. Its main duty was soil erosion prevention in the region north of Norris Lake, and it also helped fight forest fires.
